wikipedia_page.main: Frederick Hopkin (23 September 1895 – 5 March 1970) was a football player for Darlington, Manchester United and Liverpool.

response: McPherson, known as 'Curly', began his professional career with Rangers(Rangers player) McPherson, Archie, FitbaStatsMcPherson Archie Image 1 Liverpool 1930, Vintage Footballers before moving south of the border to join Liverpool in late 1929 after 18 months at Ibrox,Archie Macpherson transferred to Liverpool, Liverpool Echo, 18 November 1929, via Play Up Liverpool in which he was loaned to East Stirlingshire then had a role as back-up to Bob McPhail, deciding to leave as he was unlikely to displace the Scottish international despite impressing when he did fill in while McPhail was injured. He was to be a regular in Liverpool's first-team for the next five years, playing as an inside-left and forming a partnership with Fred Hopkin.
